title.label: Excellent Game with One Frustrating Flaw.

content.label:
First what I love about the game. The music is awesome. The graphics, smooth and the story, love it. Now the one single flaw in his awesome game........drum roll please.....Yes that’s right, the misplacement of the pause button. Update: 11/24/2020
Well I was playing with settings of the game today and low and behold I discovered that I could move the pause button from the bottom left of the display to the bottom right. This makes the game much more enjoyable as I am not constantly hitting the pause button. I changed my rating from four stars to five. I love the game even more now that the pause button is out of the way. I want to thank the developers for replying to my review. I appreciate it and hope the Aldo series of games keeps evolving. Keep up the great work.

Are used to play this game a lot but I came back to it recently and I’ll be playing with my left hand completely off my phone get the wingsuit still activates for absolutely no reason, The game is unplayable because I can’t jump without it activating the wing suit and then barreling me straight into the ground

I adore this game. It’s fun, entertaining, and very addictive. But all of a sudden whenever I try to open up the app, it doesn’t load. My screen freezes and I can’t load the app. Is this happening for anybody else??
I was all going well until I was suddenly unable to jump no matter where and what.please fix this.

I didn’t know what it was about.
I purchased it because of all the good reviews.
But it only took me 5 seconds to realize I just spent 5 dollars for nothing😃

This game is neat and very well designed, here are some suggestions. 

First, can we be given the option of having the button for wingsuit on the other side of the screen? 

Second, when I pause, I am shown with option to restart. And if I press "restart" by mistake, there is no further confirmation dialogue, this is bad sometimes...

Third, there is no obvious clue if I am doing proximity backflip, although it is shown when the move is almost finished, but it is late.

Fourth, sometimes a combination of "bunting grind" and "kiss the rail" is shown as two "kiss the rail", this seems to be a bug.

Fifth, when a "magnet" or a "llama horn" is passed after or during an "ice slide", they are likely to be missed.

Sixth, I found no obvious clue of when Tupa can climb out from chasms. It would be great to make this explicit in the notes.

Seventh, sometimes in a crash landing, the board will fly high up into the sky, this does not look realistic.

I was contemplating suicide tonight. I was dragged down by everything in my world, distressed by my social media, no music was helping. In a moment of desperation, as to keep myself busy, I opened up Altos adventure after not playing for some time. I went to zen mode and let all my thoughts go. For an hour, I felt inspired and ok. And as I’m writing this, it still lingers. I’ll be ok and that’s the best I can hope for. But thank you.

title.label: The art, music and gameplay are awesome!!!!

content.label: The art in this game is stunning and so is the music and the gameplay is unpredictable... in good way!!!

title.label: I’m not into games and I’m obsessed with this one

content.label: I bought myself an iPad and Apple Pencil and didn’t anticipate I’d use it for much other than reading, annotating, notes, and art. I can’t remember how i stumbled upon this, but my whole family is playing it now! It gets more and more challenging, getting the new characters makes it really fun. I wish there was an option to purchase items from the Workshop without having to save your coins (use your real life coins for them instead). it’s a visually stunning game, easy to learn, and fun to progress through.

Honestly I never leave reviews on apps, but since quarantine has started I’ve been getting hit with super bad panic attacks that I just can’t shake myself out of. The most effective solution thus far has been to lay down, open this game, and play until I feel more like a human. I’m incredibly grateful for this little app. It’s the perfect mix of easy to use and satisfying to master, with a beautiful soundtrack to boot.

Alto’s Adventure is so much fun! I just got the game a couple days ago and I can’t stop playing it. Definitely a 5 star rating. I was once playing this game in the Apple store on the sample phones and then I found it on the App Store and knew I had to get it. Totally worth the 5 bucks. You are trying to catch your run away llamas while riding on a beautiful snowy mountain. The graphics are amazing and don’t even get me started on the music. I love the music! There are missions and power ups and even Zen mode which is like practice mode and you never die. I would definitely recommend this game, but I have not yet tried Alto’s Odyssey. I heard that ones good too. Thank you Snowman for this wonderful game!
Awesome game!but I don’t know how to ‘respect my elders’but that’s all great game developer

This game is very fun and relaxing. Whenever I’m anxious or just want to relax this is my go-to game. The landscape and art in the background fits the mood of everything. The music is just as gorgeous as the background, too. I enjoy the popular zen mode in the game the best. Whenever Alto falls, instead of starting over again, he gets back up. I love doing the challenges. They do get a bit tricky after you start getting into the game! I put beautiful as the title because if I had to say what I said in one word, the word would be beautiful. I can’t wait to try Alto’s Odyssey! I would recommend checking that out too!👍
                                                Person
this game shouldn’t have rocks all they do is make you do a face plant right when your about to earn a achievment :(

This game is pretty worth it, but the challenges are a bit exhausting.  I had this game for FREE on my Samsung device and could easily skip a challenge if needed, which was quite helpful!  But on this device I am not able to skip a single challenge, which would be fine if the final challenge wasn’t sooooo grueling! Other than that, keep up the good work!
No review here, just some random guy saying that this game should be on everyone's phone now.

This game is awesome!! The graphics and the story is amazing! However there’s still a minor detail that has to be a thing. So, in the stickers of Altos Adventure, you can see that there are other characters. But there isn’t any mode to change your character. So why are there those people in the stickers? Maybe you actually can change the character and I’m just being stupid. I don’t honestly know. Also, when you get to the police part, it gets a little intense. He’s so ridiculously fast I always get caught. Please, please maybe lower his speed and make a setting to change your character. (Or don’t make a setting if you already did.) Acknowledge this review. I still love this game.

title.label: Very great and the best 2d game

content.label: Ggo

title.label: Thanks for the limited time offer

content.label: Just download it. Actually don’t if you don’t have a ton of time because it is so hard to put down. It is amazing.

The game looks and plays amazing. It's simple enough to get addicted and has a cuteness factor to it. But don't let that fool you. You will have to complete challenges in order to level up. Once you're past level 15 the challenges start to become harder to complete. Makes sense. That is how it should be. However, the game seems to intentionally withhold the specific terrain you need in order to complete a challenge. In my case it was to complete 2 triple backflips in one run. I have done well more than 2 in a single run while in previous levels. To pull this off, you need a tall steep drop off so you can jump off the top and have enough space to complete it. Towards the beginning of the run I am always presented with the terrain required to complete the first triple backflip. After that, you have to play FAR into that same run to be given the opportunity again. And then you think you'll have enough air to land it but, you guessed it, you never do. Quite honestly it's almost comical. My profession is in IT and I know how it works. This is a small thing you'll code into the game to keep people playing. It will always give you just enough to not become suspicious. Frankly it's the world we live in now. Skill based games don't exist anymore... 

Am I still frustrated because I couldn't land 2 triple backflips in a single run? Yes, I am. 

Will I uninstall the game out of spite? I'm not sure yet. 

Has venting in this review helped any? No, it hasn't.
It’s pretty fun and calming
I was promised llamas 🦙 but over all it’s still a good game

10/10. I’m usually a stubborn person so whenever someone recommends me something I go: no... it can’t be that good... nah, people are just praising it or whatever...

But wow. I mean, wow! This game is a goddamn piece of art. The graphics, the gameplay, the atmosphere, the music and specially the music! Everything about it is on another level. This saved my terrible day I was having. Thank you guys so much for this masterpiece. :D
Thanks, Snowman, for the free game! Fun and definitely Zen. Until I fall on my head. Story of my life. :)
